subject: Cybersecurity
title: Code Red and Nimda: The Summer of Worms
description: A quick, practical guide to Code Red and Nimda: The Summer of Worms.

hook.text: In the summer of 2001, two worms raced across the internet weeks apart, infecting hundreds of thousands.

buildup.text: Code Red exploited a Windows IIS flaw, defacing websites. Nimda arrived 18 days later with multiple attack vectors.

discovery.text: Nimda spread via email, web, file shares, and backdoors â€” the first truly multi-vector worm.

twist.text: Nimda was released one week after 9/11. Officials initially feared it was a coordinated cyber-terror attack.

climax.text: The twin worms proved that software monocultures create catastrophic, cascading failures.

punchline.text: Two worms in one summer rewrote security priorities.

quiz.question: What made Nimda unique compared to previous worms?
options: It used multiple attack vectors simultaneously
